page.title: 10FARMING IN SERLBY. (1)
page.content: {Interview with Mr Skelton.} We went to a farm in Serlby and asked the owner a few questions. Mr Skelton grows sugar beet, barley, potatoes and peas. The sugar beet goes to Newark factory. The barley goes to various places.Some is used for seed, some for brewing and some is exported. The potatoes go to Leicester to make crisps. The peas go for freezing. He has 450 acres of land.Some is rented and 170 acres is his own.He rents the land from Lady Agnew. His land is a sandy loam. The fertilizer he uses for potatoes is 7 parts N, 14 parts P and 28 parts K; for sugar beet it is 7 parts N, 8 parts P and 22 parts K; for corn it is 20 parts N, 14 parts P and 14 parts K. N stands for the nitrogen content,P for the phosphate content and the K is for the potash content.
